entries.meaning: The act or process of recasting.
(linguistics) An utterance translated into another grammatical form.
examples: Adults may use recasts to suggest corrections to mistakes in children's speech.

verbs.description: recast (third-person singular simple present recasts, present participle recasting, simple past and past participle recast)

examples: The whole bell had to be recast although it had only one tiny, hardly visible crack.

entries.meaning: To reproduce in a new form.
examples: Our conception of the world rises in us as our intellect recasts [translating umgiesst] the impressions it receives from without into the forms of time, space, and causality.

entries.meaning: (transitive, film, theater) To assign (roles in a play or performance) to different actors.
(transitive, film, theater) To assign (actors) to different roles.
examples: She was recast as the villain.
